str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To converse, address, preach, lecture; I argue, reason. Middle voice from dia and lego; to say thoroughly, i.e. Discuss.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To reverence, worship, adore. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. Adore.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From ageiro; properly, the town-square; by implication, a market or thoroughfare.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To come by chance, chance to meet. From para and tugchano; to chance near, i.e. Fall in with.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
